paragraphs.p1: This corridor allows for a longer analysis period, as Madrid - Seville was the first connection in Spanish HSR network, in 1992. The connection to Málaga was completed in 2007.
paragraphs.p2: The construction of the high-speed infrastructure is estimated to have generated 5.2 million tons of CO2e. In total, HSR has accumulated 6.1 million tons of CO2e, which includes 11% operational emissions (up to 2019).
paragraphs.p3: The air mode accumulates 3.4 million tons of CO2e over the period.
paragraphs.p4: The accumulated volume of railway demand, increased by the growth of recent years, makes the accumulated emissions per railway passenger (48 kg CO2e) lower than those of each air passenger (90 kg CO2e).
